page.title: 04FARMING : KENLEY GREEN FARM
page.content: Kenley Green Farm is an example of a mixed farm in Boarhills, keeping beef cattle as well as growing a large variety of crops. The cattle are mostly Charollais crossed with Hereford and Simmenthal. The continental breeds increase the overall weight of the animal. Plant breeding techniques over the last 10 years have resulted in hybrids which greatly improve quality and yields.Crops which are grown are wide-ranging; winter and spring barley, broccoli, potatoes, turnips, brussels sprouts, oilseed rape and grass. Irrigation pumps take water from the Kenley Burn and use it in times of water shortage. However, because of the increasing use of fertilisers and pesticides, the burn has become polluted, particularly by nitrates.
